revised_title: Determining Steam Pressure Based on Temperature
tldr: The author, John Curr, proposes a simple law to determine the pressure of steam corresponding to any given temperature, without relying on experiments. He constructs a formula based on the assumption that the vaporizing point of water under a given pressure is 100 degrees Celsius. Curr compares his results with the experiments of the Academy of Sciences of Paris, finding that his formula's temperatures are consistently lower.
